business.headline: Switzerland withdraws India's 'most favoured nation' status: 2 key impacts Switzerland will suspend the MFN clause in its DTAA with India starting January 1, 2025, increasing dividend taxes for Indian businesses operating in the country.

Swiggy share price hits all-time high today. Here's what drove the rallySwiggy stock: Swiggy made its stock market debut on November 13, listing at a 7.69% premium. The stock opened at Rs 420 per share on the NSE, compared to its IPO price of Rs 390.

Sensex, Nifty end in red as IT stocks drag markets; Titan shares down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 348.55 points to close at 81,748.57, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 100.05 points to end at 24,668.25.

Bitcoin hits record high, soars over $106,000. 3 things to knowBitcoin, the world's leading cryptocurrency, reached a record high above $106,000, driving positive momentum in other cryptos.

Sai Life Sciences IPO allotment: Check status, GMP, and listing dateSai Life Sciences IPO allotment: Investors who applied for the Sai Life Sciences IPO can check their allotment status on the BSE and Kfin Technologies Limited websites.

Why Narayana Murthy believes Indians should work 70 hours a weekNarayana Murthy has stood by his stance on work-life balance and his recent comments come amid continued debate over his previous suggestion that young Indians should commit to a 70-hour work week.

Vishal Mega Mart IPO allotment: Online guide to check status. See latest GMPVishal Mega Mart IPO allotment: Investors who applied for the Vishal Mega Mart IPO can check their allotment status on the BSE and KFin Technologies Limited websites.

Mobikwik IPO allotment status: Where to check? GMP, expected listing dateMobikwik IPO allotment status: Investors can check their allotment status online. They can log in to either the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT stocks drag; bearish trends continueThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 279.70 points to 81,853.42, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 74 points to 24,694.30.

Switzerland cancels 'most favoured nation' status to India over Nestle ruling The Swiss government has suspended the MFN clause in its tax treaty with India, potentially leading to higher taxes on Indian companies operating in Switzerland. This move follows a Supreme Court ruling affecting the interpretation of the MFN clause.
Bill Gates to go bankrupt? Tesla CEO Elon Musk explains howElon Musk claims Bill Gates could face bankruptcy over his alleged Tesla short position if the company dominates globally.
Uncovered: Network of suspected scam sites lure 'dabba' tradersIndia Today uncovers a web of suspected scammer sites posing as platforms for the "dabba" stock trade, an illegal practice.

Oh Gary, how could you: Elon Musk mocks US body amid Twitter stock probeA letter from Elon Musk's attorney, Alex Spiro, addressed to outgoing US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Chair Gary Gensler, alleged that the agency gave Musk a 48-hour ultimatum.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to end higher; FMCG and IT stocks lead recoveryThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 843.16 points to close at 82,133.12, while the NSE Nifty50 added 219.60 points to end at 24,768.30.
EPFO key amendments: Now faster claims and more interest benefits for membersEPFO's amendments focus on reducing delays, quicker claims, and better interest benefits for its members.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Never considered resigning or fleeing Syria: Assad's first remarks from RussiaOusted Syrian President Bashar al-Assad, who rose to power in 2000, saw his regime collapse on December 8 after rebel groups launched a rapid offensive capturing Damascus.

EVM row: INDIA hits different buttons, BJP calls bloc 'biggest scam'The Trinamool Congress on Monday joined J&K Chief Minister Omar Abdullah to dismiss the Congress's claims on the reliability of Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs).

What's in Nehru's Edwina letters and why a storm after 80 years?The Prime Ministers' Museum and Library has requested the return of personal letters written by Jawaharlal Nehru to Edwina Mountbatten, Jayaprakash Narayan, and Albert Einstein, among others. The focus is, however, on Nehru's letters to Edwina. What is in these letters that the BJP allege have been carted away by Congress leader Sonia Gandhi?

11 Indians killed in Georgia mountain resort due to carbon monoxide poisoningEleven Indian nationals were among 12 people found dead from carbon monoxide poisoning at a restaurant in Gudauri, Georgia. The victims were all employed at the restaurant. Georgian authorities have started a probe but confirmed there were no signs of violence.
No, Soursop, a fruit, cannot cure cancer Soursop, a close cousin of the famous custard apple, is gaining buzz on social media for its anti-cancerous properties.

Explained: Why TM Krishna can't project himself as MS Subbulakshmi Award recipientThe Supreme Court has prohibited Carnatic vocalist TM Krishna from identifying as a recipient of the Sangita Kalanidhi MS Subbulakshmi award. This decision follows a plea by MS Subbulakshmi's grandson, citing Krishna's controversial remarks.

Diljit Dosanjh dismisses 'Panjab' spelling row: Love India, don't need to proveDiljit Dosanjh found himself in hot water after spelling 'Punjab' as 'Panjab' in a social media post. Today, the singer-actor cleared his stance on X.

Chhattisgarh man swallows live chick. Man dies, bird survivesDoctors in Chhattisgarh were shocked to find an alive chick inside the stomach of a 35-year-old man who had allegedly swallowed it as part of a superstitious ritual to fulfil his wish of becoming a father.

Watch: Daredevil Gukesh goes bungee jumping after winning world championshipWorld champion D Gukesh kept his promise to his coach Grzegorz Gajewski and went bungee jumping in Singapore after his thrilling victory against Ding Liren. Gukesh posted a video of the same on his social media account.

How India won 1971 War on water, sank Pakistan's Ghazi hunting for INS VikrantVijay Diwas: The 1971 India-Pakistan War, often perceived to be a terrestrial war, saw crucial action by the Indian Navy. The Navy attacked the Karachi harbour twice, crippling Pakistan's naval capabilities, and also sank PNS Ghazi. The submarine, leased from the US, was tasked with destroying INS Vikrant, India's only aircraft carrier.

Congress's 'erasing history' charge as iconic 1971 surrender photo swapped outVijay Diwas: Congress MP Manickam Tagore alleged the painting's removal was part of a broader effort by the BJP government to "erase or reframe historical events that do not align with certain narratives."

Zakir Hussain's beats of ecstasy: From India Today Magazine archives (1988)The late Zakir Hussain had a special relationship with father Alla Rakha both on and off stage. This 1988 INDIA TODAY article explores their artistic yearnings
When fear rules the mind a bathroom becomes a bedroom; the absurdity of VaastuWhen fear rules the mind, you can make science out of everything.

Video: Woman, 65, attacked by stray dogs on deserted road in JalandharA pack of stray dogs attacked a 65-year-old woman who was returning from a gurdwara in Punjab's Jalandhar. She suffered serious injuries to her body and head due to the attack.

Islamic radicals infiltrating MEC 7 fitness units across north Kerala?A fitness programme in Kerala, MEC 7, is under scrutiny for allegedly being used by banned groups like PFI and Jama'at-e-Islami to spread radicalism. Both the CPI(M) and the BJP have raised concerns that MEC 7, which operates over 1,000 units across northern Kerala, had allegedly been infiltrated by Islamist radicals.
Pune cop loses Rs 2.3 lakh after scanning QR code to pay at local bakeryA police constable in Pune fell prey to a QR code scam, losing Rs 2.3 lakh in a shocking incident.

At 14 degree Celsius, why is Mumbai suddenly so coldThis trend represents a stark contrast to the typical daytime highs of around 31 degrees Celsius and nighttime lows of approximately 20 degrees Celsius that Mumbai is used to.

Did Guru Randhawa join Diljit Dosanjh's Punjab vs Panjab controversy? See postGuru Randhawa shared a cryptic message, seemingly getting into the centre of a heated 'Punjab vs Panjab' debate. It started after Diljit Dosanjh wrote Panjab in one of his posts.

Sikandar teaser to release on Salman Khan's 59th birthday: ReportThe much-awaited teaser for Sikandar will be reportedly release on Salman Khan's 59th birthday. Fans are eager for this special birthday treat from the Bollywood superstar.

Ramanand Sagar's grandson Shiv on Kaakbhushundi Ramayan: A tribute to his legacyRamanand Sagar's grandson, Shiv Sagar, continues his legacy with Kaakbhushundi Ramayan, blending high-tech VFX and music to bring a fresh perspective for the new generation. The show, airing on Doordarshan, aims to tell the untold stories of Kaakbhushundi while maintaining the essence of the original Ramayan.

Isa Guha is a brave woman: Ravi Shastri praises her for apologising to BumrahRavi Shastri praised Isa Guha and called her a brave woman for apologising to Jasprit Bumrah. Bumrah picked up his 2nd 5-wicket haul of the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy series.

Marsh reveals reason behind animated celebration after Shubman Gill catchMitchell Marsh's spectacular gully catch to dismiss Shubman Gill, coupled with animated celebrations aimed at amusing teammates, capped a brilliant fielding effort that helped Australia mount immense pressure on India during Day 3 of the Brisbane Test.

The India fast bowler jokingly told the scribe to google his batting record.

Tim Southee on missing 100-sixes landmark in final Test: Sorry to disappointNew Zealand fast bowler Tim Southee missed out on entering the 100-sixes club in Test cricket as he finished his career with 98 sixes on Day 3 of the third Test vs England.

Jason Gillespie slams Pakistan board, details reasons behind resignationFormer Pakistan Test team coach Jason Gillespie has detailed the reasons behind his unceremonious exit from his role. Gillespie, who took up the role in April, decided to quit right before the South Africa Tests got underway.

Ben Stokes injury plagues England as New Zealand sniff consolation winNew Zealand tightened their grip on the third Test, setting England a mammoth 658-run target as early wickets and Ben Stokes' hamstring injury compounded England's misery, leaving them reeling at 18/2 at stumps on Day 3 in Hamilton.

'Saar pe kuch hai?': Watch Rohit lose his cool after Akash Deep's wide deliveryBorder-Gavaskar Trophy 2024: Captain Rohit Sharma vented out his frustration at Akash Deep after the fast bowler delivered a wide ball on Day 3 of the third Test in Brisbane.

Australia break India's Gabba pride between frequent rain breaks on Day 3India's resistance at Gabba seemed to be slowly fading away as the top order suffered yet another collapse on Day 3 of the third Test in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy on Monday, December 16. The day was marred by constant rain delays, which could prove to be a blessing in disguise for India in the end.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
